articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER BAY — For 20 years now, at least, the Gardiner-Reedsport-Winchester Bay Salmon Trout Enhancement Program — or S.T.E.P — has been spawning and raising tens of thousands of fish annually, mostly chinook salmon, that are added to the Lower…
articles.title: Over three decades of providing a helping hand

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: It's been a busy week for the delegates of Kuki-Shi, Japan. During their tour of the Roseburg area for the Roseburg Sister Cities exchange program, they've been given a taste of its artistry, industry and culture.
articles.title: Kuki-Shi mayor and delegates put down roots in Douglas County with tree planting ceremony

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Stewart Park Bridge will be closed to all foot and bicycle traffic 6 a.m. until about 7 p.m. Wednesday as part of the roadway resurfacing of the rehabilitation project that has closed regular bridge traffic since February.
articles.title: Stewart Park Bridge is closed to pedestrians on Wednesday

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jeremy Brett Vroman, 48, faces multiple felony charges after allegedly committing two crimes in one day, including a daycare burglary and breaking a home’s window. He appeared via video from jail after refusing to attend his arraignment and has declined a court-appointed attorney.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Faces Multiple Charges After Two-Day Crime Spree and Jail Outburst

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: October 10, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Students at Roseburg High walked out Wednesday during eighth period to protest transgender students using locker rooms matching their gender identity. Counter-protesters also attended, calling the demonstration transphobic. Oregon law allows students to use facilities by gender identity.
articles.title: Students Walk Out at Roseburg High Over Locker Room Access Debate

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Firefighters responded to a house fire Tuesday morning on Buckhorn Road in Dixonville. Flames were coming from several windows, and one kitten was rescued. The blaze started from a heat lamp used to warm baby chickens, officials said. No injuries were reported.
articles.title: Heat Lamp Blamed for Dixonville House Fire; Kitten Rescued

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Florida man has been arrested for allegedly starting the blaze that became January’s deadly Palisades Fire in Los Angeles, which killed 12 and destroyed thousands of homes. Officials say 29-year-old Jonathan Rinderknecht first set a smaller fire that later reignited amid strong winds.
articles.title: [National News] Florida Man Arrested for Arson in Deadly Palisades Fire That Killed 12

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: October 9, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Spearheaders Leather Goods is opening its new storefront in Roseburg on Oct. 11. Owned by local craftsman Dan Spencer, the shop features handmade belts, wallets, and bags. The grand opening runs 2–6 p.m. at 1614 NE Vine St, Suite 102, with vendors, displays, and in-store specials.
articles.title: Spearheaders Leather Goods Opens New Storefront in Downtown Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man was arrested after deputies found 48.3 grams of fentanyl and 11 grams of meth. Detectives say 47-year-old Clinton Reed admitted to planning a fentanyl sale. He faces multiple charges for unlawful delivery and possession of controlled substances.
articles.title: Major Drug Arrest in Roseburg Nets Fentanyl and Methamphetamine

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Three California men are facing charges after a Roseburg pharmacy burglary early Friday. Police found evidence after their getaway vehicle crashed on Old Melrose Road. Two suspects posted bail and were released, while the third was cited at the hospital due to crash injuries.
articles.title: Three California Men Charged in Roseburg Pharmacy Burglary — All Later Released

articles.title: Stewart Park Bridge in Roseburg closes Oct. 8 for rehab work
